articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Issue of DPRK-U.S. Talks
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Result of DPRK-U.S. Talks
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The spokesman of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on Wednesday gave the following answer as regards questions raised by KCNA concerning the result of the latest DPRK-U.S. high-level talks:
					Delegations of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) and the United States of America (U.S.) met in Beijing, China on 23rd and 24th of February for the third round of the high-level talks between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					Present at the talks were the delegation of the DPRK headed by Kim Kye Gwan, the First Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs, and the delegation of the U.S. headed by Glyn Davies, the Special Representative of the State Department for the DPRK Policy.
					
					The talks, continuation of the two previous DPRK-U.S. high-level talks held respectively in July and October, 2011, offered a venue for sincere and in-depth discussion of issues concerning the measures aimed at building confidence for the improvement of relations between the DPRK and the U.S. as well as issues related with ensuring peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and resumption of the six-party talks.
					
					Both the DPRK and the U.S. reaffirmed their commitments to the September 19 Joint Statement and recognized that the 1953 Armistice Agreement is the cornerstone of peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula until the conclusion of a peace treaty.
					
					Both the DPRK and the U.S. agreed to make a number of simultaneous moves aimed at building confidence as part of the efforts to improve the relations between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					The U.S. reaffirmed that it no longer has hostile intent toward the DPRK and that it is prepared to take steps to improve the bilateral relations in the spirit of mutual respect for sovereignty and equality.
					
					The U.S. also agreed to take steps to increase people-to-people exchanges, including in the areas of culture, education, and sports.
					
					The U.S. promised to offer 240,000 metric tons of nutritional assistance with the prospect of additional food assistance, for which both the DPRK and the U.S. would finalize the administrative details in the immediate future.
					
					The U.S. made it clear that sanctions against the DPRK are not targeting the civilian sector, including the livelihood of people.
					
					Once the six-party talks are resumed, priority will be given to the discussion of issues concerning the lifting of sanctions on the DPRK and provision of light water reactors.
					
					Both the DPRK and the U.S. affirmed that it is in mutual interest to ensure peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, improve the relations between the DPRK and the U.S., and push ahead with the denuclearization through dialogue and negotiations. 
					
					Both sides agreed to continue the talks.
					
					The DPRK, upon request by the U.S. and with a view to maintaining positive atmosphere for the DPRK-U.S. high-level talks, agreed to a moratorium on nuclear tests, long-range missile launches, and uranium enrichment activity at Nyongbyon and allow the IAEA to monitor the moratorium on uranium enrichment while productive dialogues continue.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Lao Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets New Lao Ambassador
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday had a talk with new Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Kiettisak Keobanhdith who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Senior WPK Official Meets New Lao Ambassador
articles.content:
Senior WPK Official Meets New Lao Ambassador
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Wednesday had a talk with new Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Kiettisak Keobanhdith who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: New Documentaries Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
New Documentaries Produced in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be alive in the hearts of people" (Volumes 1 and 2), Part 1 of the documentary "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will be immortal", was produced in the DPRK.
					The documentaries show historic scenes of the DPRK army and people bidding last farewell to the fatherly leader in bitterest grief over his sudden loss, demonstrating the single-minded unity unprecedented in history.
					
					They show all the service personnel and people overcome with grief over the sad news that leader Kim Jong Il passed away on December 17, 2011 to their sorrow so suddenly and so early.
					
					They also contain scenes showing overseas Koreans visiting the homeland to mourn the passing of the benevolent father and the prominent leader of the nation.
					
					There are in the documentaries scenes showing diplomatic envoys of foreign countries and representatives of international bodies, members of the military attaches corps and foreign personages visiting the bier of Kim Jong Il to pay their last respects in deep reverence for him.
					
					They show the state funeral and millions of citizens and service personnel in bitter grief along the routes extending over 40km. 
					
					Every scene of the documentaries represents the conviction and will of the revolutionary ranks of Songun to advance along the road of socialism led to victory by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					The documentaries were screened at the People's Palace of Culture in Pyongyang on Wednesday. 
					
					Among the audience were senior officials of the party and the state, officials of party and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and working people in the city.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kuwaiti PM and Deputy PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kuwaiti PM, Deputy PM
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, on Feb. 25 sent a congratulatory message to Jaber Al Mubarak Al Hamad Al Sabah on his reappointment as prime minister of the State of Kuwait.
					He in the message sincerely wished him new success in his important work for the development and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between two countries would continue to develop favorably.
					
					Meanwhile, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, sent a similar message to Sabah Al Khalid Al Hamad Al Sabah upon his reappointment as deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs of the State of Kuwait.

articles.title: Greetings to Kuwaiti Deputy Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Kuwaiti Deputy Prime Minister
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Monday sent a message of greeting to Sabah Al Khalid Al Hamad Al Sabah, deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs who is chairman of the Board of Directors of the Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development, on the occasion of the 50th founding anniversary of the fund. 
					The message said that after the foundation, the fund has made a great contribution to economic development of developing countries through its positive activities in the spirit of South-South cooperation over the past 50 years. 
					
					Expressing conviction that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will further expand and develop in future, Pak wished him greater successes in the work of the fund.

articles.title: Songun Politics Serves as Banner for Protecting National Sovereignty, Peace
articles.content:
Songun Politics Serves as Banner for Protecting National Sovereignty, Peace
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- No force on earth can hold in check the dynamic advance of the DPRK to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the uplifted great banner of Songun. 
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					It is thanks to the might of Songun that the DPRK has honorably defended the sovereignty of the country and national dignity, frustrating the moves of the U.S. and its followers to escalate the political and military confrontation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					The Songun politics helps realize the nation's centuries-old desire for a strong national power of the country, putting the national dignity and pride on the highest level. 
					
					It is under the banner of Songun that the country's national power has been placed on the highest level and the greatest heyday of prosperity in the national history spanning 5 000 years has been ushered in and the dignity and pride of the Korean nation have been fully demonstrated before the whole world. 
					
					It is by dint of the Songun politics that the Workers' Party of Korea is more dynamically pushing forward the socialist cause, bravely meeting the challenge of the U.S. styling itself the world's only "superpower".
					
					The Songun politics helps effect a great surge not only in the military field but in the drive for building an economic power, significantly raising the position of the DPRK in the international arena. 
					
					It is thanks to the might of Songun that peace has been preserved on the Korean Peninsula and security of all the fellow countrymen is guaranteed. The adoption of the June 15 joint declaration the keynote of which is the idea of "By our nation itself" and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, is a brilliant fruition of the idea and line of the WPK for national reunification, Songun politics. After the publication of the June 15 joint declaration the national reunification movement made a steady advance along the road of independent reunification, peace and prosperity and brought about signal successes in the development of the north-south relations. 
					
					Songun politics shines as a symbol of independence and dignity. But for it, there would have been neither country nor nation. 
					
					The Korean nation is highly proud and honored to have the Songun politics.

articles.title: Senior U.S. Military Official's Remarks on DPRK's Provocation Dismissed
articles.content:
Senior U.S. Military Official's Remarks on DPRK's Provocation Dismissed
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Locklear was informally designated as commander-in-chief of the U.S. forces in the Pacific, at a recent hearing of the Senate Armed Services Committee, made such reckless remarks that he is greatly concerned about the possible provocation from the DPRK. He also said when appointed as commander of the U.S. forces in the Pacific, he would handle the north Korean issue on a top priority basis and it is necessary for the U.S. to boost the capability for gathering intelligence about the DPRK.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: This is anti-DPRK jargons not worth even a passing note. It explains who is really likely to make provocations.
					
					There are a series of moves between the DPRK and the U.S. for dialogue these days. There are, however, conflicting developments. The U.S. side is staging war maneuvers to do harm to the dialogue partner while conducting talks for narrowing down differences between the two sides. This only makes the process for settling the problems complicated.
					
					What should not be overlooked is the fact that the above-said brass hat commanded the operation for "invasion of Libya" last year in the capacity of commander of fleet in Europe and Africa and commander of NATO forces. It is nobody's secret how this operation was kicked off after perpetrating provocations against the opponent.
					
					Clear is the ulterior aim of the U.S. ruling quarters that informally designated the above-said war-maniac as commander timed to coincide with the pursuance of the policy of attaching importance to Asia-Pacific and the announcement of the new defense strategy in the U.S. It is to launch the second Korean War on the Korean Peninsula, drawing on the experience gained in the actual war.

articles.title: Utility Insulating Bricks Turned Out in DPRK
articles.content:
Utility Insulating Bricks Turned Out in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Utility insulating products are mass-produced in the DPRK.
					Among them are insulating bricks, used as refractory in electro-thermal furnaces and lagging in other furnaces.
					
					They can be also used as fire-proof materials in movable heat-treating furnace as they are very light. 
					
					They, high in heat radiation capacity, reduce energy loss and power consumption and raise the quality of products.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Lashes at Lee Myung Bak for Backing Japan's Territorial Ambition
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Lashes at Lee Myung Bak for Backing Japan's Territorial Ambition
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- South Korea's Lee Myung Bak has drawn public criticism after the disclosure of his pro-Japan remarks on Tok Islets that he denied at the beginning of his office. 
					The WikiLeaks recently revealed the facts that when Japanese Prime Minister Fukuda at a meeting with Lee in July 2008 proposed to mark Tok Islets as part of the territory of Japan in "new guidelines for teaching" social subjects to primary and middle schoolers of Japan, Lee asked Fukuda to "wait for a while as it was difficult that moment".
					
					At that time Lee Myung Bak insisted he never made such controversial remarks, but his detailed remarks were opened to public by the then first secretary of the south Korean embassy in Tokyo with his words that he "felt something perfidious".
					
					The issue of sovereignty over Tok Islets does not allow even a slight concession as it was an acute issue related to part of the inviolable territory of Korea that has been handed down through generations.
					
					But, Lee's promise to hand over Tok Islets to Japan, watching for a chance after abandoning them, was known to the public, touching off the anger of all Koreans.
					
					Since its seizure of power, his regime has pursued diplomacy of submission and sycophancy toward Japan, conniving at and encouraging the Japanese reactionaries in their moves to grab Tok Islets and instigated them to stage a comeback to Korea. 
					
					The regime has advocated "quiet diplomacy", describing south Korea-Japan relations "future-oriented relations of not asking about the past" and talking about "a new era of cooperation".
					
					Whenever the Japanese reactionaries conducted brigandish acts as regards the islets, the regime has never properly taken issue with them, taking an ambiguous attitude. It claimed "south Korea should not get involved in a dispute" and "it should exercise restraint". 
					
					When the oceanologic institute in south Korea tried to set up a comprehensive oceanologic base for studying Tok Islets, the Lee regime forced it to delete the words "Tok Islets" from its full name as it might get on the nerves of Japan.
					
					This humiliating pro-Japanese sycophancy and treachery are encouraging the Japanese reactionaries in their ambition to seize the islets.
					
					Japan is becoming evermore arrogant in its bid to grab Tok Islets, part of the inviolable territory of Korea.
					
					In recent years, Japan's claim to Tok Islets was openly recorded in the "white paper on defence", "diplomatic blue book" and other state documents and in documents distributed to foreign countries and even in introductory notes of textbooks for the younger generation.
					
					When Japanese Foreign Minister Kenba uttered "he should say what he had in mind" as regards the dominium over Tok Islets shortly ago, Prime Minister Noda officially  supported his remarks,  saying "he clarified Japan's stand".
					
					Japan remains unchanged in its ambition to seize islets no matter how much water may flow under the bridge and no matter who comes to power.
					
					The Lee Myung Bak regime is kowtowing to Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation, even offering land, while standing in confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					The Korean nation can never escape disasters nor can the south Korean people be free from misfortune as long as Lee and other traitors are allowed to stay in power.

articles.title: KCNA Terms "Nuclear Security Summit" Farce by Nuclear Criminals
articles.content:
KCNA Terms "Nuclear Security Summit" Farce by Nuclear Criminals
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korea's  Lee Myung Bak regime are openly justifying the Seoul "nuclear security summit". 
					They claim that "the summit would mark the starting point for realizing a world without nuclear weapons" and that "it would be a very hopeful option." 
					
					This is shameless sophism to cover up their true colors as nuclear criminals and their crimes and deceive the international community. 
					
					The U.S. is the world's biggest nuclear weapons state and the chief culprit which sneaked nuclear weapons into the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					The south Korean authorities are nuclear maniacs who turned south Korea into a nuclear advance base for the U.S. and the hotbed of nuclear war. 
					
					Irony is that the nuclear criminals are set to host the "nuclear security summit" in south Korea, one of the world's dangerous nuclear magazines, during the nuclear war exercises when a war may break out any moment. 
					
					The Lee group has put much effort into advertising the agenda items to justify the Seoul "summit". 
					
					The core of the nuclear security is to reduce and dismantle nuclear weapons. There can be no nuclear security apart from it. 
					
					Nevertheless, they made the transfer of nuclear materials, minimization of highly enriched uranium and other issues as agenda items and asserted that they would make contribution to building "a world without nuclear weapons ". This only reveals the deceptive nature of the "summit". 
					
					Intolerable is that the Lee group of traitors said the Seoul "summit" would be of important significance for south Korea, in particular, as it is exposed to "nuclear threat". 
					
					The nuclear threats to the Korean Peninsula come from the U.S. and south Korean authorities which are obsessed by reckless nuclear ambition. 
					
					The DPRK has become the target of the U.S. nukes deployed in south Korea and the heavy clouds of a nuclear war hang over the Korean Peninsula. This is the stark reality of the peninsula. 
					
					No other nation in the world has been exposed to longer nuclear threats than the Korean nation. The nuclear threat to the Korean people is by no means an abstract concept. 
					
					The Lee group's talk about "nuclear threat from the north" is a mockery of and insult to the Korean people and mankind who hope to see the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world denuclearized. 
					
					It is imperative to remove the nuclear threats from the U.S. and south Korea to substantially ensure nuclear security and peace in the peninsula. 
					
					The nuclear security summit should serve as a gathering for revealing the nuclear war strategy of the U.S. and south Korean authorities from historical point of view and for withdrawing nukes from south Korea. 
					
					Without discussion of these matters, the summit will just turn to the theatre of an armchair argument and will increase nuclear threat in the peninsula.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses Japan of Toeing U.S. Policy
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses Japan of Toeing U.S. Policy
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the Japanese prime minister expressed an intention to examine the issue of dispatching Self-Defense Forces to Hormuz Strait. He said at the budget committee of the House of Representatives that "it is necessary to assume that something would happen in Hormuz Strait". 
					Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: The issue of dispatching SDF to Hormuz Strait is a product of Japan's inveterate bad habit of toeing the U.S. policy. 
					
					It goes on: 
					
					As the U.S. is well aware of Japan's bad habit of toeing the U.S. policy and its ulterior aim to realize its ambition for overseas aggression with the U.S. backing, it strongly urged the latter to back the former in its sanctions against Iran and military pressure upon it. 
					
					It is just like a suicide, indeed,  for Japan to get involved in the complicated nuclear issue of Iran as oil from Iran takes a big share of Japan's oil import. 
					
					This being a hard reality, Japan is keen to rush to Mideast where a war may break out any moment, assuming even hypothesis and sidestepping everything. This can be explained by the fact that what the Japanese politicians fear more than anything else is not "any harm to its national interests" but the fate of being forsaken by their master. 
					
					Japanese politicians are accustomed to always reading the face of its U.S. master when making policy decisions, big or small, putting aside the interests of Japan or will and wishes of its people.
					
					It is quite natural that world people deride Japan as a servant of the U.S. and a political pigmy. 
					
					Japan should feel disgrace for this.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Greeting WPK Conference with High Political Enthusiasm
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Greeting WPK Conference with High Political Enthusiasm
Pyongyang, February 29 -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday editorially calls upon all the people to unite close around the dear respected Kim Jong Un and greet the forthcoming conference of the Workers' Party of Korea with a high degree of political enthusiasm and labor achievements.
					The Party conference is of particular significance in the party development and accomplishment of the Juche revolution as it will open at a historic juncture when a new century of Kim Il Sung's Korea starts, it says, and goes on:
					
					The WPK has marked a new historic turning point in its development.
					
					Kim Jong Un is standing at the head of the WPK and revolution.
					
					Under his guidance the Korean revolution is making more dynamic advances and registering signal achievements in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					The party and revolution have a rosier prospect as the bloodline of Mt. Paektu is given steady continuity generation after generation and the center of the leadership and unity remains unshakable.
					
					With Kim Jong Un at the helm of the WPK, it is shedding its rays as a steel-strong party with the greatest dynamism, a revolutionary one with a strong sense of organization and firm unity and principle and as a great mother party genuinely serving the people, deeply rooted among them. 
					
					It is the immense pride that the revolutionary comrades-in-arms of Songun are united closer around the Central Committee of the WPK, sharing thought and intention with Kim Jong Un and keeping pace with him.
					
					The forthcoming conference of the WPK will offer an opportunity of increasing its position and role as a powerful political staff for the Songun revolution, steadfast in monolithic ideology and leadership.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling Imperialists' Moves to Tighten Sanctions
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling Imperialists' Moves to Tighten Sanctions
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article calls for foiling the imperialists' evermore undisguised moves to tighten sanctions.
					Referring to the aims sought by the imperialists in tightening sanctions, the article notes:
					
					The imperialists are deliberately interfering in the internal affairs of other countries in a bid to impose Western style "view on value" on them.
					
					When this method turns out to be unworkable, they woo the United Nations, etc. into taking collective measures for sanctions. They go lengths of taking such outrageous and arbitrary actions as perpetrating armed invasion.
					
					When any country fails to meekly obey them, the hegemonic forces run the whole gamut of plots to find an excuse for slapping sanctions against it.
					
					They are aimed at hindering its economic development and deteriorating its people's living.
					
					Then the imperialists conduct false propaganda that the failure in this respect is attributable to its wrong state policy, instigating its people to anti-government actions and creating illusion about them in a bid to bring down its government.
					
					They are working hard to weaken the defence capabilities of other nations in an effort to establish military domination over them with ease.
					
					A lot is suggested by what is going on in the region of Persian Gulf where the situation is so tense that even a slight accidental case can spark off a war.
					
					The forces hostile to the DPRK have enforced sanctions on the Korean people for more than half a century in the most despicable manner.
					
					The U.S. is contemplating taking a measure for escalating the sanctions on the DPRK these days, the article notes. The imperialists, however, can never browbeat the Korean people through the sanctions.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Demand Halt to Anti-DPRK War Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Demand Halt to Anti-DPRK War Exercises
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Reconciliation and Reunification of the Council of Christian Churches in south Korea in a statement on Feb. 27 lashed out at the DPRK-targeted military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle jointly launched by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers.
					This saber-rattling is escalating the tensions between the north and the south and laying a stumbling block in the way of ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					The statement urged them to stop at once the military drills which will further deteriorate the inter-Korean relations.
					
					On the same day the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea also made public a statement demanding a halt to the anti-DPRK war maneuvers. 
					
					More than 50 civic and public organizations of south Korea including the Solidarity for Progress and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held a press conference outside the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Military Command" on the same day at which they slammed the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle. 
					
					A joint statement was read out at the conference.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Calls for Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Calls for Peace on Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held its regular meeting in Seoul on Feb. 25 where it called for making positive efforts for peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					At the meeting the speakers accused the Intelligence Service of searching the houses and offices of the core members of the organization on Feb. 8 on charges of the violation of the "Security Law".
					
					It is the organization's duty to drive the U.S. forces out of south Korea and realize the peaceful reunification, they noted, adding the latest crackdown is the last-ditch effort made by the conservative ruling forces, being afraid of the existence of the organization and its activities.
					
					They clarified that they would work hard to ensure peace on Korean Peninsula, end servile relationship of alliance with the U.S. and defend the right to existence of the popular masses.
					
					They declared they would direct efforts to ensuring the conclusion of a peace treaty this year, opposing the construction of a naval base on Jeju Island, opposing the DPRK-targeted joint military exercises with the U.S. and checking the import of the U.S.-made weapons.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Their Rash Actions
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Their Rash Actions
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea Wednesday made public the following statement:
					The U.S. imperialist aggressors and south Korean puppet warmongers started on Monday large-scale "Key Resolve" and "Foal Eagle" joint military exercises defying the strong warning of the DPRK, concerns and accusations from public at home and abroad. 
					
					Involved in the drills are huge troops and latest war equipment of the U.S. forces and the south Korean army. 
					
					This saber-rattling clearly shows that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean authorities are ferocious warmongers who stoop to anything to achieve their ulterior goal of aggression no matter how the situation develops and no matter what public opinion at home and abroad demands. 
					
					They assert that the drills are "annual defensive ones" and "drills to cope with provocation" from someone, but their aggressive nature and danger have already been fully disclosed before the world. 
					
					They openly declared that the drills are to cope with local and all-out wars and "contingency" and operation plans for them are being implemented under the simulated conditions of an actual war. Even the largest-ever landing operation exercise in history is scheduled to take place, targeting against main points of the DPRK. 
					
					Few days ago, south Korean warmongers together with GIs ran amuck to launch a grave military provocation on Yonphyong and Paekryong islands again. Kim Kwan Jin, defense minister of south Korea, ordered its army units to fire at the north before getting permission when the north reacts. This shows how desperate they have become in their moves to ignite a war against the north. 
					
					This saber-rattling is particularly dangerous as they are kicking up an anti-DPRK smear campaign and intensifying their moves to escalate the confrontation on an unprecedented scale and making desperate efforts to seek a way out of a serious ruling crisis. 
					
					They run the whole gamut of intrigues to break the single-minded unity and destabilize the society of the DPRK, with groundless slanders as regards the great loss in the DPRK. 
					
					They regard the present time when the people of the DPRK are still grieving over the greatest loss of the nation as a golden chance to realize their goal of aggression which they failed to do in over six decades. They are staging large scale war drills in a bid to rattle the nerves of the DPRK and lead it to counteraction and thus attack it on that pretext. 
					
					Their frantic war exercises are the last-ditch efforts to scuttle the efforts of those countries concerned for detente, turn their position in the elections in their favor and thus get rid of the worst political crisis.
					
					The ongoing saber-rattling has brought the hypocritical nature of "dialogue" much touted by the U.S. imperialists and south Korean authorities into bolder relief. 
					
					They are going to test the will of the army and people of the DPRK through provocative saber-rattling but the DPRK has already clarified its resolute stand. 
					
					If they provoke a war against the DPRK, the consequences will be hardly imaginable. 
					
					If another war breaks out in Korea, war shambles will not be limited to the Korean Peninsula only as was the case with the last June 25 war and the aggressors will suffer an incomparably bitter defeat than what they sustained at that time and meet a miserable end. 
					
					The army and people of the DPRK will not miss the opportunity to wipe out the U.S. imperialist aggressors, the sworn enemy of the nation, and the Lee group of traitors who desecrated the great loss to the nation and rubbed salt into the wounds of the fellow countrymen. They will also achieve the cause of national liberation and reunification of the country at any cost, satisfying their pent-up grudge. 
					
					The U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime would be well advised to behave themselves, bearing deep in mind what severe punishment the invincible army and people of the DPRK will mete out to them when giving full play to their mental power.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea War Drills Condemned by Overseas Koreans Organizations
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea War Drills Condemned by Overseas Koreans Organizations
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, Sunday made public a statement condemning the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers for their war hysteria. 
					The U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors finally embarked upon the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises for aggression and this is an undisguised and blatant challenge to the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula, the statement said, and went on:
					
					It is the unanimous will of Koreans in the north and the south and overseas not to pardon the U.S. imperialist aggressors and Lee group of traitors for driving the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase after trampling down the wishes of all the fellow countrymen for peace and reunification of the country. 
					
					The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia on the same day released a statement in which it demanded the south Korean authorities stop at once such act of treachery as doing harm to compatriots in league with outside forces. 
					
					The Federation of Young Koreans in China on Monday made public a similar statement denouncing the war drills.

articles.title: Russian Figure Expresses Concern over U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises
articles.content:
Russian Figure Expresses Concern over U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Sergei Rudyanin, deputy director of the Institute of the Far East of the Russian Academy of Sciences, said that the large-scale joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. and south Korea are evidently a provocation aimed at counteraction from the DPRK.
					According to Voice of Russia, he said it is of grave concern that the rehearsal was commenced at a very inappropriate time and will last for nearly two months. This will result in very tense situation between the north and the south of Korea, he added.
					
					Rudyanin stressed its gravity lies in the fact that the issue of denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula has not yet been settled and the six-party talks have been brought to a stalemate.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Intensify Anti-DPRK and Anti- Chongryon Campaign
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Intensify Anti-DPRK, Anti- Chongryon Campaign
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The Public Security Department of the Metropolitan Police Office of Japan committed such fascist action as searching the offices of the Korean Scientists and Technologists Association and the Korean Amateur Athletes Federation in Japan in the Korean Publishing Hall in Tokyo on Feb. 28 on charges of violation of "law on management of foreign exchange."
					The public security authorities mobilized more than 150 riot police and 25 police vehicles at 8 in the morning to completely block the entrance to the hall. Then they barred officials from entering the hall before conducting a search operation.
					
					They confiscated computers, files, etc. in the course of the search that lasted for as long as four hours.
					
					They searched every floor and even the roof of the hall which have nothing to do with their activities. 
					
					The authorities also instigated media of Japan to spread wild rumors about the DPRK and Chongryon to tarnish the image of Chongryon organizations.
					
					They took this tyrannical action on false charges that a compatriot in Tokyo "illegally exported" computers to the DPRK.
					
					The officials of the hall offered stubborn resistance against the riot police in protest against the search operation.
					
					Upon hearing the news of the search, officials of the Chongryon organizations in Tokyo, the Korean Youth League in Japan and the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan and compatriots joined in the protest.
					
					The security authorities also conducted a search operation against the offices of the Itabashi branch of the Chongryon and Chukai Travel Agency under Chongryon on similar charges on the same day.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Commemorated in Guinea and Malaysia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Commemorated in Guinea and Malaysia
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Visits to a greenhouse of Kimilsungia and an art performance took place in Guinea and dissemination of Korean songs in Malaysia from Feb. 2 to 17 to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The general secretary of the Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia Association of Guinea praised President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as peerless great men who made great contributions to the human cause of independence.
					
					He said that it was a great honor for them to have a chance to visit the Kimilsungia greenhouse on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, adding that Kimilsungia would be in fuller bloom along with the immortal exploits of the peerless great men as they are revered by all people.
					
					The deputy rector of an art college of Guinea said that the more one hears the "Song of General Kim Jong Il," the further one feels inspired by it.
					
					Though Kim Jong Il passed away, he will always be alive in the hearts of the progressive people for his great exploits.
					
					The chairman of the Malaysian Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the 70th Birth Anniversary of Leader Kim Jong Il said that progressive mankind deeply reveres and follows Kim Jong Il because it is totally fascinated by his personality as a great man.
					
					He stressed that Kim Jong Il will always be alive as an outstanding leader of the era of independence amid the boundless admiration of mankind.
					
					He referred to the fact that they will widely disseminate the song "General on a Galloping White Horse" dedicated to him and successfully represent it so that they may put it on the stage of the April Spring Friendship Art Festival.

articles.title: Massacres of Koreans by Japanese Imperialists in 1919
articles.content:
Massacres of Koreans by Japanese Imperialists in 1919
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists had committed genocides against Koreans during their past colonial rule over Korea.
					Typical of them was massacre of Korean people who rose up in the March First Popular Resistance in 1919.
					
					The Koreans suffered bitter humiliation and maltreatment under the barbarous "military rule" of the Japanese imperialists, and at last their pent-up resentment and rancor developed into a nation-wide resistance on March 1, 1919.
					
					The participants in the resistance valiantly fought in defiance of the harsh suppression by the Japanese army and police, chanting "Independence of Korea!" and "Japanese and their army, go home!"
					
					This uprising spread throughout 13 provinces of the country including Pyongyang and Seoul.
					
					The Japanese imperialists hurled the 19th and 20th Divisions of the Japanese army and police forces present in Korea at that time into crackdown on peaceful demonstrators and shipped into Korea six battalions and many military policemen from their proper. All ruling tools and repressive means were employed to quell the resistance.
					
					They set fire to 317 houses in 15 villages and murdered more than 1 000 inhabitants in Suwon County, Kyonggi Province, alone.
					
					They turned Pyongyang and Seoul into a sea of blood and slaughtered 60 odd people in Maengsan County, South Phyongan Province early in March.
					
					They also shot to death at least 500 in Jongju of North Phyongan Province and 150 in Milyang of South Kyongsang Province.
					
					The number of people killed by the Japanese imperialists in the whole period of the uprising totaled some 100 000.
					
					Meanwhile 587 640 people had been arrested from March 1 to the end of May.
					
					Those figures go to clearly show the cruelty of the Japanese imperialists who mercilessly trampled down the elementary political freedom and rights of the Korean people and their right to existence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Organizations of Brazil, Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Organizations of Brazil, Nigeria
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Brazil and Nigeria on Feb. 20 posted on their Internet homepages special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea carried explanatory notes with photos on the themes of "Birth of Shining Star of Mt. Paektu", "Great inheritance", "Genius of creation and construction", "Peerlessly Songun brilliant commander", "Benevolent father" and "Lodestar of national reunification" under the bannerline title  "Whole life of leader Kim Jong Il seen through photos".
					
					The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea in an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il will always be alive" praised the feats he performed by defending socialism and ushering in a new era of building a thriving nation under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					It gave a detailed account of the fact that he opened a bright prospect for national reunification and dynamically promoted global independence.
					
					Noting that he was the tender-hearted father of the people, the article stressed history has never known such great man who devoted all his life to the people as him.
					
					He will always be alive in the hearts of the Korean people and progressive mankind, it concluded.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Jong Il Lauded by Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Jong Il Lauded by Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Papers of different countries carried special write-ups interwoven with articles on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The Russian newspaper Nakhodkinski Rabochi on Jan. 27 carried a special write-up illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un waving back to the cheering masses.
					
					The paper recalled that Kim Jong Il resolutely foiled the moves of the imperialists to provoke a war with the might of Songun.
					
					Byvor on Feb. 10 and No. 18 issue of Priamuruskie Vedomosti of the country carried articles praising the undying feats Kim Jong Il performed by making a great contribution to the prosperity of the country and independent and peaceful reunification of the country and the development of the DPRK-Russia friendly relations.
					
					The Tanzanian paper Mwananchi on Feb. 16 said that Kim Jong Il not only firmly defended socialist Korea by standing against the imperialist allied forces, holding high the banner of Songun but also wisely led the DPRK to register great successes in all fields.
					
					The Syrian paper Al Thawrah on Feb. 16 introduced the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il in leading the army.
					
					Al Baath of the country on Feb. 19 carried an article on the great contribution Kim Jong Il made to global independence.

articles.title: U.S. Real Intention to Stifle DPRK Exposed by Paper of Czech Republic
articles.content:
U.S. Real Intention to Stifle DPRK Exposed by Paper of Czech Republic
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The February issue of Dialog, the paper of the Czech Republic, carried an article titled "Who is just between DPRK and U.S.?"
					The DPRK has become a target of U.S. false propaganda, the article said, and went on:
					
					While talking about "the DPRK's threat" to the world peace, the Americans do not know about what is important here.
					
					In the Korean War the DPRK lost millions of people at the hands of U.S. forces.
					
					The U.S., far from apologizing for the indiscriminate killings of Koreans, has persistently pursued a policy for stifling the DPRK for nearly 60 years since the ceasefire.
					
					The U.S.-led sanctions have played a basic role in hindering the economic development in the DPRK.
					
					For what reason the U.S. is designating the DPRK as an "axis of evil"?
					
					The DPRK, a victim of U.S. aggression, is now being unreasonably branded as a country "supporting" terrorism and "threatening" the world peace.
					
					Due to this stereotyped false propaganda of the U.S. a lie sounds like truth and nobody has the courage to probe the truth.
					
					If the DPRK is regarded as "threat", is the U.S. not an aggressor?
					
					Then to which does the U.S. fall "victim"?
					
					It is the ulterior intention of the U.S. to stifle the DPRK, slander its people and block the reunification of Korea at any cost.

articles.title: Chilean Political Party Praises DPRK as Fortress of Struggle for Socialism
articles.content:
Chilean Political Party Praises DPRK as Fortress of Struggle for Socialism
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) on Feb. 23 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "DPRK, fortress of struggle for sovereignty and liberation, anti-imperialism and socialism".
					The DPRK has stood firm on the first line of the struggle for sovereignty, independence and against imperialism, the article said, and went on:
					
					The Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) has invariably supported socialist construction in the DPRK, standing firm on its side since its founding.
					
					Noting that the first secretary of the party issued a statement titled "Comrade Kim Jong Il was a guardian of socialism" on his 70th birth anniversary, the article carried its full text.

articles.title: Spokesman for Chinese Defence Ministry Slams Japan's Smear Campaign
articles.content:
Spokesman for Chinese Defence Ministry Slams Japan's Smear Campaign
Beijing, February 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of National Defense at a recent press conference rejected Japan's smear campaign against his country.
					The spokesman said Japan's talk about "threat from China" is unfavorable not only for the military relations between the two countries but for peace and stability in the region, adding that his country rationally sets the scope of the defence budget on the basis of the nation's security need and the level of development of the national economy.
					
					Recalling that on the contrary Japan has massively bolstered up its military capability, he said this is drawing the attention of the international community and neighboring countries in particular.
					
					Japan should remain faithful to its commitments to take the road of peaceful development, taking history as a mirror, and stop pulling up others this or that way.

articles.title: U.S. Launches Communications Satellite for Military Purpose
articles.content:
U.S. Launches Communications Satellite for Military Purpose
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Navy on Feb. 25 sent a 3G communications satellite into orbit from the Cape Canaveral Air Force Station. This is part of its programme for aerial espionage against other countries.
					The satellite will reportedly provide intelligence to aircraft, submarines and ground forces.

articles.title: U.S. Prepares War against Iran: TV
articles.content:
U.S. Prepares War against Iran: TV
Tehran, February 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has buckled down to getting itself ready for war against Iran citing its nuclear programme. 
					An Iranian TV Sunday reported that the U.S. recently deployed thousands of its troops in Socotra Island of Yemen to strike nuclear facilities of Iran. 
					
					It said that the U.S. had secretly pushed forward the construction of air and naval bases on the island from long ago as part of the preparations for the war. 
					
					The U.S. moves arouse serious concerns of the international community.

articles.title: PNA Condemns Israeli Killing of Palestinian Protestor
articles.content:
PNA Condemns Israeli Killing of Palestinian Protestor
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- The Palestinian National Authority (PNA) on Saturday condemned the death of a Palestinian protestor by Israeli fire in the West Bank.
					"This is a crime for which the Israeli government is fully responsible," said Salam Fayyad, Palestinian premier in the West Bank.
					
					Talat Ramia, 25, died on Friday, hours after he was shot during clashes between Palestinians and Israeli forces at a checkpoint near Kuds. Four other stone throwers were injured.

articles.title: Iran Warns Israel of Its Military Threat
articles.content:
Iran Warns Israel of Its Military Threat
Tehran, February 28 (KCNA) -- The minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics of Iran warned Israel of its military threats to his country.
					The minister dismissed a spate of war outbursts let loose by Israeli officials against Iran as foolish.
					
					The Zionist regime is on the verge of ruin, he said. Any military attack on his country would bring self-destruction to Israel.

articles.title: Kuwaiti Deputy PM Opposes Military Attack on Iran
articles.content:
Kuwaiti Deputy PM Opposes Military Attack on Iran
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Sheikh Sabah Al Khalid Al Hamad Al Sabah, deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Kuwait, recently expressed opposition to any military attack on Iran.
					Kuwait will not provide any base for attacking Iran in its territorial air, land and waters, he noted.
					
					The issue of Iran's nuclear programme should be settled through dialogue, instead of sanctions and other means.

articles.title: President of Belarus Calls for Social Unity
articles.content:
President of Belarus Calls for Social Unity
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- President of Belarus Aleksandr Lukashenko recently called for social unity.
					The pressure on Belarus is gaining in scope and getting crafty in its methods in the fields of politics, economy, etc., the president said. The national defence is no longer an issue related to the service personnel only.
					
					The social unity ensures a strategic edge in any showdown, he said.
					
					Noting that the mode of social, political and economic development in Belarus has been confirmed to be solid, he expressed conviction that the nation's military mechanism would provide the people with peaceful and creative labor and stability.
					
					The present world is facing new challenges and threats, he noted, adding more and more countries are exposed to undisguised aggression.

articles.title: Afghan NATO Base Attacked
articles.content:
Afghan NATO Base Attacked
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- Seven U.S. military trainers were wounded on Sunday when a grenade was thrown at their base in northern Afghanistan, local police said.
					The attack took place when anti-Western fury was deepening over the burning of the Koran at a NATO base.

articles.title: New Virus Affecting Livestock Detected in Europe
articles.content:
New Virus Affecting Livestock Detected in Europe
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- A new virus affecting livestock has recently been detected in Europe, sparking off great concern.
					It, causing birth defects and miscarriages in livestock, was detected for the first time in Germany. It was also detected in thousands of farms in France, the Netherlands, Italy, Luxembourg, UK and other European countries.
					
					If domestic animals are infected with the disease they may abort or breed deformed ones.
					
					The damage is predicted to be rapidly increased.

articles.title: GIs' Desecration of Quran Censured by Islamic World
articles.content:
GIs' Desecration of Quran Censured by Islamic World
Pyongyang, February 29 (KCNA) -- GIs in Bagram air force base in Afghanistan recently burned the Holy Quran, enraging the Islamic world.
					Serious is that it was executed at the instructions of the U.S. military authorities.
					
					The burning has instantly infuriated the people all over Afghanistan.
					
					Over 2 000 Afghanistan people gathered on Feb. 21 outside Bagram base, shouting "death to the U.S.", throwing stones into the base and burning tires.
					
					Protesters also gathered in Jalalabad and a lot of other cities to denounce the GIs' desecration of Islam, burning the U.S. flags.
					
					As the situation turned worse, the senior authorities of the U.S. kept them busy, apologizing to the Afghanistan people and vowing to delve the case.
					
					But the anti-U.S. demonstration has swept across 13 provinces of the country beyond a few cities.
					
					This also has sparked off worldwide anti-U.S. demonstration.
					
					Hundreds of demonstrators took to the streets in the capital city in Malaysia on Feb. 24, denouncing the U.S. troops in Afghanistan for killing Muslims and desecrating Islam.
					
					In Karachi of Pakistan, too, youths rallied to protest.
					
					Ahmad Khatami, Iran's high cleric, referring to the incident on Feb. 24, said it was a deliberate act stemming from Washington's hatred for Islam, not just a simple mistake.
					
					The apology made by the U.S. government officials was merely cosmetic, he said.
					
					Jordan's Muslim Brotherhood in a statement on Feb. 25 said the apology by the U.S. president is not enough, calling for sending those who burnt the Quran copies to the International Criminal Court.

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX se entrevista con ACNC por dialogo con EE.UU.
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX se entrevista con ACNC por dialogo con EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 29 de febrero (ACNC) -- Consultado por la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (ACNC) en relacion con las recientes conversaciones de alto nivel entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y los Estados Unidos de America, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia 29 la siguiente respuesta:
					Tuvo lugar los dias 23 y 24 la tercera ronda de las conversaciones de alto nivel entre la RPDC y EE.UU.
					
					Presidio la delegacion coreana el primer vicecanciller Kim Kye Gwan y encabezo la norteamericana Glyn Davies, representante especial para la politica sobre la RPDC del Departamento de Estado.
					
					En esta cita, seguida de las 2 ediciones anteriores celebradas en julio y octubre de 2011, quedaron debatidos sincera y profundamente las medidas de creacion de confianza, necesarias al mejoramiento de relaciones bilaterales, y los temas vinculados con la preservacion de paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y con la reanudacion de las conversaciones a 6 bandas.
					
					Ambas partes ratificaron la voluntad de ejecutar la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre y reconocieron que el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea funciona como piedra angular de la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana hasta que se firme el convenio de paz.
					
					Acordaron tomar simultaneamente una serie de medidas de creacion de confianza, como parte de los esfuerzos por mejorar las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					EE.UU. reafirmo su posicion de no hostilizar mas a la RPDC y su disposicion de mejorar las relaciones bilaterales en el principio de respeto a la soberania y el espiritu de igualdad.
					
					EE.UU. expuso la voluntad de tomar las medidas para ampliar el intercambio del personal en varios dominios como la cultura, educacion y deportes.
					
					Se comprometio a suministrar a la RPDC 240 mil toneladas de alimentos nutritivos y a esforzarse por posibilitar la asistencia adicional de alimentos.
					
					Ambas partes quedaron en adoptar enseguida las medidas administrativas para ese fin.
					
					EE.UU. dejo en claro que la sancion anti-RPDC no apunta al sector civil como la vida del pueblo.
					
					Cuando se reanuden las conversaciones a 6 bandas, se debatiran con prioridad el levantamiento de la sancion anti-RPDC y el suministro a esta de los reactores de agua ligera.
					
					Ambas partes coincidieron en seguir conversando tras confirmar que convienen a los intereses de todas partes preservar la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana mediante el dialogo y negociaciones, mejorar las relaciones RPDC-EE.UU. y realizar la desnuclearizacion.
					
					Para mantener el clima positivo al dialogo de alto nivel RPDC-EE.UU., la primera decidio a instancia del segundo suspender temporalmente en lo que vayan las conversaciones fructiferas la prueba nuclear, el lanzamiento de misiles de largo alcance y el enriquecimiento de uranio en Nyongbyon y permitir el monitoreo de la Agencia Internacional de Energia Atomica sobre esa ultima actividad.

articles.title: Portavoz del CNCDP condena "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle"
articles.content:
Portavoz del CNCDP condena "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle"
Pyongyang, 29 de febrero (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz (CNCDP) publico el dia 29 una declaracion con motivo de las maniobras conjuntas de gran dimension "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" iniciadas por Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas.
					El texto de la nota sigue:
					
					Pese a las fuertes advertencias de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y a la preocupacion y condena de la opinion publica interna y externa, los agresores norteamericanos y los belicistas titeres surcoreanos despliegan a partir del dia 27 los ejercicios militares conjuntos de gran dimension "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle".
					
					En estos dias, enormes fuerzas armadas de EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea realizan en suelo surcoreano esos ejercicios de guerra movilizando generalmente los equipos belicos sofisticados.
					
					Eso demuestra claramente que los imperialistas norteamericanos y la camarilla de titeres surcoreanos son maniacos de guerra capaces de cometer cualquier cosa, sea cual fuera la situacion o la opinion publica interna y externa, para alcanzar sus objetivos agresivos.
					
					Todo el mundo conocio el caracter agresivo y peligroso de la presente edicion de "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle", aunque aquellos los describen como "entrenamientos anuales de defensa para hacer frente a la provocacion".
					
					EE.UU. y los belicistas surcoreanos hablan publicamente que la presente edicion tiene por su meta prepararse a la guerra local y la total y a la supuesta "situacion de emergencia".
					
					Practicamente, los planes de operaciones correspondientes se implementan en el clima de combate de verdad y esta previsto hasta un ejercicio de la operacion de desembarco de maxima dimension en la historia en los simulados puntos importantes de la RPDC.
					
					Hace unos dias, los belicistas surcoreanos trataron de cometer otra grave provocacion militar en las islas Yonphyong y Paekryong con la ayuda de las tropas agresoras norteamericanas.
					
					El ministro de Defensa surcoreano Kim Kwan Jin instruyo a las unidades del ejercito surcoreano abrir el fuego sin esperar la orden en el caso de que el Norte de Corea reaccione.
					
					Estos hechos corroboran que ellos estan desesperados para desatar la guerra de agresion al Norte.
					
					Las presentes maniobras resultan sumamente peligrosas porque coinciden con que los imperialistas norteamericanos y los titeres surcoreanos recrudecen mas que nunca su campana intrigante y conflictiva contra la RPDC y andan enloquecidos para buscar la salida de la extremada crisis de dominacion.
					
					Ultimamente, ellos recurren a todas las artimanas para abrir hueco en la unidad monolitica de la RPDC y desestabilizarla por adentro difundiendo unos chismes sobre el gran duelo nacional.
					
					Tomando estos tiempos, en que el pueblo de la RPDC no se ha recuperado todavia de su maxima perdida (fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il), como la oportunidad de oro para alcanzar las metas de agresion incumplidas durante mas de 6 decadas pasadas, ellos quieren atacar a la RPDC irritandola con las maniobras de guerra e induciendola a reaccionar.
					
					Esos ejercicios significan el ultimo coletazo de la camarilla surcoreana para congelar los esfuerzos de los paises interesados por relajar la situacion al agravar la tension de la Peninsula Coreana y para salir de la peor crisis politica al invertir las desfavorables circunstancias electorales.
					
					Igualmente, evidencian el caracter hipocrita del "dialogo" pregonado por EE.UU. y sus lacayos surcoreanos.
					
					Si bien ellos tratan de sopesar con "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" la voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC, estos expusieron ya su posicion rotunda.
					
					Si EE.UU. y los belicistas surcoreanos incurren en la provocacion contra la RPDC, sufriran las consecuencias dificiles de imaginar.
					
					En el caso de que se desate nuevamente la guerra en Corea, su escenario no se limitara a la Peninsula Coreana en contra de lo que ha pasado en la guerra coreana estallada el 25 de junio de 1950, y los agresores correran un destino tragico sufriendo una derrota incomparablemente grande que la de entonces.
					
					Aprovechando esa oportunidad, el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC descargaran su acumulado rencor e ira al exterminar a los agresores norteamericanos, enemigos jurados de la nacion, y sus satelites, la camarilla del traidor Lee Myung Bak, salvajes que ofendieron el gran duelo nacional, y cumpliran asi sin falta la causa de liberacion nacional y la de reunificacion de la patria.
					
					EE.UU. y sus satelites surcoreanos deben actuar con prudencia dandose cuenta de que seran sometidos a un castigo tan terrible cuando se manifiesten generalmente las fuerzas espirituales del invencible ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu (Ejercito Popular de Corea) y todos los militares y civiles de la RPDC.

articles.title: ACNC critica a vendepatria projapones Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
ACNC critica a vendepatria projapones Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 29 de febrero (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el sitio web WikiLeaks revelo la verdad del disparate projapones sobre el islote Tok, pronunciado por el traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak en primeros momentos de su mandato. 
					En julio de 2008, el premier japones de aquel entonces, Fukuda, dijo que anotaria en la "nueva guia de estudio" sobre las asignaturas sociales de las escuelas primarias y secundarias de Japon el islote Tok como un territorio japones. 
					
					Entonces, el traidor Lee Myung Bak le rogo: "espere, ahora es dificil aceptarlo". 
					
					La banda de Lee Myung Bak nego que no habia  dicho asi. Pero, fue publicada la verdad por el primer secretario de aquel entonces de la embajada surcoreana en Japon el contenido concreto de las palabras de traidor Lee y la palabra del mismo secretario de "haber sentido perfidia por el respecto". 
					
					La soberania del islote Tok es un tema agudo sobre el sagrado territorio de la nacion coreana heredado generacion tras generacion. Pues, no podemos dar ni un paso atras en ese tema. 
					
					Pero, la banda traidora de Lee renuncio facilmente la soberania del islote Tok y prometio entregarlo a Japon en el tiempo oportuno. Tal acto traidor suscita la indignacion de toda la nacion coreana.
					
					Despues de tomar el poder, la banda traidora surcoreana vino instigando las maniobras de nueva agresion de los reaccionarios japoneses tolerando su intencion de usurpar el islote Tok con su diplomacia y sus actos vendepatrias y projaponeses. 
					
					Preconizo la "diplomacia tranquila" hablando de las "relaciones con vistas al futuro sin cuestionar el pasado" y la "nueva era de cooperacion" con Japon. 
					
					Cuando los reaccionarios japoneses cometian los actos gangsteriles en cuanto al islote Tok, no lo cuestiono ni una vez diciendo que "no debemos arrastrarnos por el conflicto" y "es necesario mantener la paciencia". 
					
					Cuando el Instituto Maritimo del Sur de Corea trataba de instalar una universal base cientifica maritima sobre el islote Tok, le obligo omitir la expresion del islote Tok diciendo que esta palabra ofendera a Japon. 
					
					Tal proceder projapones de la banda traidora surcoreana estimula la ambicion de Japon de usurpar el islote Tok. 
					
					Japon actua mas arrogantemente para usurpar el islote Tok, parte de sagrado territorio coreano. 
					
					En los ultimos anos en la "carta blanca de defensa", la "carta azul diplomatica" y otros documentos estatales, los libros que se distribuyen al extranjero y hasta las guias de manuales para nuevas generaciones anotan el islote Tok como "territorio japones". 
					
					Hace poco, el canciller japones Kenba, dijo abiertamente que "dire si es necesario respecto al derecho a la soberania del islote Tok", y el premier Noda le apoyo oficialmente diciendo que "el expreso la posicion de Japon". 
					
					Es invariable la ambicion agresiva de Japon de usurpar el islote Tok aunque pasa mucho tiempo y se sustituye el poder. 
					
					Sin embargo, la banda traidora surcoreana se enfrenta con armas a sus connacionales, pero obedece al enemigo jurado de la nacion entregando hasta el territorio patrio. 
					
					Mientras que exista la horda de vendepatrias como el traidor Lee Myung Bak, toda la nacion coreana no puede evitar la desgracia.

articles.title: ACNC comenta "Cumbre de Seguridad Nuclear"

ACNC comenta "Cumbre de Seguridad Nuclear"
Pyongyang, 29 de febrero (ACNC) -- Ahora se tornan mas abiertas las maniobras de Estados Unidos y la banda traidora de Lee Myung Bak destinadas a racionalizar la "Cumbre de Seguridad Nuclear" de Seul.
					Ellos la justifican describiendola como "primera partida hacia el mundo sin nucleo" y diciendo que es "una opcion muy deseable".
					
					Pero, todo esto no pasa de ser una sofisteria descarada para encubrir su vil naturaleza y crimen de los delincuentes nucleares y enganar a la sociedad internacional.
					
					EE.UU. es el mayor poseedor de arma nuclear en el mundo y el fautor de la nuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Mientras tanto, son la banda titere surcoreana los fanaticos nucleares quienes han convertido el suelo surcoreano en una base avanzada nuclear de EE.UU. y el origen de guerra nuclear.
					
					Es ilogico que tales delincuentes nucleares planean efectuar la citada Cumbre en una zona muy candente precisamente en el periodo de los ejercicios de guerra nuclear.
					
					La banda traidora se entrega a dar publicidad de la agenda de la cumbre con el fin de justificar la "Cumbre" de Seul.
					
					El clave en la seguridad nuclear es la reduccion y abolicion de las armas nucleares, al margen de lo cual  no existira la seguridad nuclear.
					
					Sin embargo, pone sobre el tapete el tema de traslado de las materias nucleares y la reduccion al minimo de uranio altamente enriquecido diciendo que esto contribuira a hacer un "mundo libre de armas nucleares", pero cuya insistencia revela mas la  naturaleza  fraudulenta de la "cumbre".
					
					Es imperdonable que la banda de traidor de Lee habla de que la "cumbre" tiene gran significacion especial para el Sur de Corea que recibe la "amenaza nuclear". 
					
					La amenaza nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana proviene de la imprudente ambicion nuclear de EE.UU. y la banda titere.
					
					Es la nitida realidad de la Peninsula Coreana en que huele el polvorin de las armas nucleares norteamericanas ubicadas para la guerra real en el Sur de Corea.
					
					No hay en el mundo la nacion como la coreana que recibe directa y largamente la amenaza nuclear. Para esta nacion, la amenaza nuclear no es un concepto abstracto.
					
					La banda traidora de Lee habla de la "amenaza nuclear del Norte", lo que es una burla y insulto al pueblo coreano y el resto del mundo que desean la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana y el mundo.
					
					Para asegurar realmente la seguridad nuclear y la paz en la Peninsula Coreana, debe ser eliminada radicalmente la amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. y los titeres del Sur de Corea.
					
					La Cumbre de Seguridad Nuclear debe ser una reunion para tomar las concretas medidas para  denunciar con datos historicos la estrategia de guerra nuclear de EE.UU. y la banda titere y eliminar las armas nucleares del territorio surcoreano.
					
					Sin ella, la Cumbre sera una cita inutil y al contrario provocara el aumento de la amenaza nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana.
